thread.title: Prep football moves past midpoint of season
thread.title_full: Prep football moves past midpoint of season

author: E. Marcel Pourtout mpourtout@neighbornewspapers.com (noreply@neighbornewspapers.com)
title: Prep football moves past midpoint of season
text: Prep football moves past midpoint of season by E. Marcel Pourtout September 30, 2015 02:27 PM | 208 views | 0 | 1 | Staff / Katherine FryeCambridge’s Eric Cizek attempts to run past Kell’s Nicholas Woghiren during team’s contest on Sept. 25. The Bears won the home game 21-7. slideshow With the midway portion of the prep football season passing this week, several programs have continued their strong starts and placed themselves in prime position for a postseason bid.Cambridge hosted its biggest regular-season contest in its four-year history last Friday when the Bears hosted Kell for first place in Region 7 . Behind a team-high 114 rushing yards from Kaelin Byrd, Cambridge emerged with the 21-7 victory, improving its record to 3-1. Byrd now has a team-high six rushing touchdowns on the season. The Bears’ defense was also stout, holding the Longhorn’s high-powered offense to only 212 yards.“The win came from our kids and their belief in each other,” Cambridge coach Craig Bennett said. “Their heart, conviction to go all in was the difference for us. I couldn’t be more proud of a group of kids.”The win was the Bears’ first victory over the Longhorns in three contests. Cambridge returns to action this Friday on the road at North Atlanta at Grady Stadium. After winning its first two contests, the Warriors have dropped three straight including last Friday’s 37-7 road loss to Sprayberry. Cambridge won last season’s contest against North Atlanta 45-3.Roswell stayed undefeated on the season with a 42-3 home win over Milton last Friday, improving its record to 4-0. Hornets’ quarterback Quintarius Neely completed 14 passes for 229 yards and three touchdowns on the night. Running back Sheldon Evans rushed for 72 yards and two touchdowns. Roswell allowed only 103 yards of total yards to the Eagles.The Hornets, who have outscored opponents 188-13 this season, will face their toughest test of the year as they host Walton this Friday. The Raiders are 5-0 on the season and coming off of a 22-19 home win against Wheeler on Sept. 18.King’s Ridge will host Fellowship Christian in a Region 6A contest this Friday. The home Tigers are looking for their first win of the season, dropping their last game at Trion 61-0 last week. The Paladins are also seeking to get a win to snap their two-game losing streak after starting the season with two wins. Fellowship Christian lost at Christian Heritage 31-28 in its last contest on Sept. 18.King’s Ridge holds a 3-2 lifetime series lead over Fellowship Christian. However, the Paladins have won the last two contests, including last year’s 47-28 home victory.Mount Pisgah Christian will travel across Alpharetta to face cross-town rival St. Francis in another Region 6A contest. Each team enters the contest with matching records of 1-3 will be the region opener.The Patriots dropped their last contest at home to Christian Heritage 27-20 while the Knights were defeated 21-14 by Walker. Mount Pisgah won last year’s game 39-20.Several programs are off this Friday but earned wins in their previous contests including Blessed Trinity who improved to 5-0 with its 38-3 win at home against Douglass Sept. 25. Running back Milton Shelton had 195 yards on 15 carries and three touchdowns. The senior now has 11 touchdowns on the season. Titans’ quarterback Conor Davis completed two touchdown passes to freshman tight end JD Bertrand in the win.Centennial won its second-straight, defeating Johns Creek 35-21 last Friday. Caden Herring has a strong all-around performance, rushing for 103 yards, amassing 49 yards receiving and returned a kickoff 99 yards for a score. He also had six tackles and one interception on defense. Herring finished the night with four touchdowns. The Knights’ defense also held Johns Creek to only 80 yards of rushing late into the fourth quarter.“We were able to establish a run game and played really good on defense,” Centennial coach Lenny Gregory said. “I was really proud of how well our kids played and like how we’re learning to play within our scheme. The kids are gaining confidence.”Alpharetta improved to 3-2 on the season with a 48-30 win at Habersham Central last Friday while Chattahoochee lost to South Forsyth 40-9.
